writer.name: 阿彼察邦·韦拉斯哈古 Apichatpong Weerasethakul

director.name: 阿彼察邦·韦拉斯哈古 Apichatpong Weerasethakul

introduction: A few years ago I visited a temple near my home and a monk there gave me a little book called “A Man Who Can Recall His Past Lives.” In it, the monk wrote about Boonmee, who could recall his multiple lives in the cities of the northeast. In 2008, I wrote a screenplay inspired by the reincarnation of Boonmee, and started to travel in the region in search of his surviving offspring and relatives. I met his two sons who provided accounts of their father.In Nabua in December 2008, I located several houses that I thought would be suitable as Uncle Boonmee’s house in the proposed feature film. This short film is a personal letter describing my Nabua to Uncle Boonmee.The film is comprised of shots of the houses’ interiors in the evening. They are all deserted except one house with a group of young soldiers, played by some teens of Nabua. Two of them impersonate me by narrating the film.- Apichatpong Weerasethakulhttp://www.kickthemachine.com/works/Primitive%20sub_website/Primitive_Short_films/A_Letter_to_Uncle_Boonmee.html
